definitions.definition: Protected from heat , cold , noise etc, by being surrounded with an insulating material.
Isolated or separated from other conducting materials, or sources of electricity .
examples: Early insulated wires were covered in silk rather than plastic.

definitions.definition: Situated at so great a distance as to be beyond the effect of gravitation ; said of stars supposed to be so far apart that the effect of their mutual attraction is undetectable  .

main_definition: Protected from heat , cold , noise etc, by being surrounded with an insulating material.
secondary_definitions: ( of an electrically conducting material ) Isolated or separated from other conducting materials, or sources of electricity .

( astronomy , dated ) Situated at so great a distance as to be beyond the effect of gravitation ; said of stars supposed to be so far apart that the effect of their mutual attraction is undetectable  .
